title: Nicholas P. Sweeney
text:
I am a PhD researcher in the Department of Land Economy at the University of Cambridge. My work sits at the intersection of economic geography, regional economics, and place-based policy, with a focus on England.



Devolution and multi-level governance
Spatial inequalities and local economic development
Political (dis)engagement in declining places
High streets, retail diversity, and spatial consumption patterns
Mobility, access to services, and health inequalities





Causal inference in applied microeconometrics (e.g. difference-in-differences, matching, IV)
Spatial data and geospatial analysis (QGIS / GIS workflows)
Reproducible research in R and Python





See Publications for papers and working papers.
See CV for a full academic CV (PDF).





Email: nicholas@npsweeney.co.uk (or your current preferred email)
